item.title: 《金融时报》称美国正考虑在特朗普与习近平峰会前向台湾出售新武器
item.description: 据《金融时报》报道，美国正准备向台湾出售新武器，这令中国官员感到不安，甚至可能危及特朗普总统原定于4月对中国进行的访问。【原文：The US is preparing new arms sales to Taiwan, which have unsettled Chinese officials to the point that President Donald Trump’s planned visit to China in April could be in jeopardy, according to the Financial Times.】

item.title: Anthropic’s More Than $20 Billion Funding to Close as Soon as Next Week
item.description: Anthropic PBC is ironing out the final details on a funding round likely to raise more than $20 billion and slated to close as soon as next week, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Investor Angst Turns to India Earnings After Trade Clouds Clear
item.description: After two trade deals lifted a key overhang on Indian equities, investor attention is shifting back to the market’s persistently weak earnings outlook.

item.title: Bondholders Allege American Dream Mall Colluded to Cut Value
item.description: A New Jersey town and owners of the American Dream mall colluded to reduce the assessed value of the shopping and entertainment complex in a move that now jeopardizes repayment of $800 million in municipal debt, bondholders alleged in a lawsuit.

item.title: Minimum Wage Shock Pushes Colombian Inflation Higher in January
item.description: Colombian inflation accelerated in January after a record increase in the minimum wage, cementing expectations that the central bank will keep lifting interest rates.

item.title: Hedge Funds Cut Bullish Gold Wagers to Lowest in 15 Weeks
item.description: Money managers slashed their bullish wagers on gold to the lowest since October as the precious metal suffered its biggest price plunge in more than a decade last week.

item.title: Trump Removes India’s 25% Russia-Related Tariff After Deal
item.description: President Donald Trump eliminated the extra 25% tariff he had imposed on Indian goods over the country’s purchases of Russian oil, the first step to cement the terms of a trade deal the two nations announced earlier this week.

item.title: Wall Street Drama Punishes Speculation and Rewards Steady Bets
item.description: For one week on Wall Street at least, steady real-economy assets beat software and speculation.

item.title: Michaels’ Comeback Hits New Peak With Bonds Near 100 Cents Again
item.description: Just about everything has gone right for Michaels Cos. since it was in dire financial straits over the risk of a US tariff shock.

item.title: Hedge Funds Hike Bullish Oil Bets to 10-Month High on Iran Risks
item.description: Hedge funds turned the most bullish on Brent crude since early April as traders hedged against the risk of a military conflict between the US and Iran and potential supply disruptions from the OPEC member.

item.title: Texas Jobs Boom Sputters on Immigrant Crackdown, Dallas Fed Says
item.description: Job growth in Texas was almost flat last year as migration to the state plunged and oil prices lagged.

item.title: Vanguard’s Average Fee Is Now Just 0.06% With Latest Cut
item.description: Vanguard keeps pace in fund fee’s race-to-the-bottom

item.title: Hedge Funds Slash Bullish Natural Gas Bets to 13-Month Low
item.description: Hedge funds cut bullish bets on US natural gas after forecasts for mild weather triggered the largest single-day price decline in front-month gas futures in 30 years, forcing traders with long positions to rapidly unwind those bets at a loss.

item.title: Google Employees Call on Company to End ICE, CBP Contracts
item.description: More than 900 employees at Alphabet Inc.’s Google have signed a petition demanding that the company sever ties with the US Department of Homeland Security in the wake of the Trump administration’s mass deportation efforts.

item.title: Credit Data Firm 9fin Seeks $1 Billion Valuation in Fund Talks
item.description: Debt intelligence provider 9fin Ltd. is in talks to raise fresh capital at a valuation of as much as $1 billion as it seeks to gain a stronger foothold in the highly competitive market for credit research.

item.title: BP’s Whiting Refinery USW Workers Authorize Potential Strike
item.description: About a quarter of the workers typically stationed at BP Plc’s Whiting, Indiana, refinery are preparing for a strike or lockout, in a move that has the potential to disrupt fuel supplies in the US Midwest.

item.title: US Consumer Credit Rose in December by the Most in a Year
item.description: US consumer borrowing increased in December by the most in a year, reflecting a pickup in both revolving and non-revolving credit.

item.title: Boston Scientific’s Worst Day in 25 Years Surprised Analysts
item.description: Few analysts foresaw the disappointing results and profit forecast that sent Boston Scientific Corp.’s shares plummeting nearly 20% this week. Even fewer have given up on their bullish calls since.

item.title: FAT Brands Lenders Want CEO Suspended Over Twin Peaks Stock Sale
item.description: Lenders to bankrupt restaurant operator FAT Brands Inc. want the chief executive officer suspended without pay over a recent stock sale for its Twin Peaks dining chain, deepening a battle for control of the company as it attempts to restructure.

item.title: Dow Jones Industrial Average Rises Past 50,000 For First Time
item.description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average broke above the 50,000 level for the first time, as investors bid up the blue-chip gauge amid optimism over the US economy and corporate earnings.

item.title: Lots More With Charlie McElligott on This Week's SaaSpocalypse
item.description: A terrible few days for software, crypto, and more.

item.title: Apple Plans to Allow Outside Voice-Controlled AI Chatbots in CarPlay
item.description: Apple Inc. is preparing to allow voice-controlled artificial intelligence apps from other companies in CarPlay, according to people familiar with the matter, a move that will let users query AI chatbots through its vehicle interface for the first time.

item.title: Lots More With Charlie McElligott on the SaaSpocalypse (Podcast)

item.title: Ex-Goldman Sachs Star Banker Leissner Goes to Prison in 1MDB Fraud
item.description: Former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. banker Tim Leissner reported to federal prison to begin serving a two-year sentence for one of the largest financial frauds in history.

item.title: Chicago Transit Deal Attracts Investor Cash Flooding Muni Market
item.description: The second-largest transit system in the US is benefiting from municipal bond investors looking to put billions of dollars to work.

item.title: Bessent Rebuts Split Between His and Trump’s Dollar Comments
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent rebutted the idea that he and Donald Trump have presented different takes on the dollar, after the president had embraced the currency’s recent drop while Bessent had touted a “strong dollar policy.”

item.title: 英伟达首席执行官称人工智能资本支出合理且可持续
item.description: 英伟达公司首席执行官黄仁勋面对客户在数据中心过度支出的担忧时表示，当前的支出水平是合理且可持续的。【原文：Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang, facing concerns that customers are overspending on data centers, said that the level of expenditures is appropriate and sustainable.】

item.title: 英伟达股价飙升，因科技巨头宣布6500亿美元人工智能支出计划
item.description: 英伟达公司股价周五飙升，投资者争相买入那些有望受益于科技巨头今年在人工智能基础设施领域巨额投资的公司股票。【原文：Nvidia Corp. shares soared Friday as investors snapped up shares of companies positioned to benefit from the vast sum of money that big technology firms have said they’ll spend on artificial intelligence infrastructure this year.】

item.title: 为何游戏股AI恐慌毫无道理
item.description: Video-game stocks inexplicably plummeted after Google revealed Genie, a tool for building virtual worlds

item.title: 詹妮弗·加纳创投公司Once Upon a Farm在1.98亿美元IPO后股价上涨17%
item.description: 由女演员詹妮弗·加纳联合创立的有机儿童零食制造商"童话农场"公司，在周五上市首日股价飙升17%，此前该公司及其部分投资者通过首次公开募股筹集了1.979亿美元。【原文：Once Upon a Farm PBC, the organic kids snacks maker co-founded by actress Jennifer Garner, jumped 17% in its trading debut Friday, after the company and some of its investors raised $197.9 million in an initial public offering.】
